name: Internal Meeting Summary
description: A structured meeting summary template written in British English. All content must be strictly derived from the transcript, with no added assumptions or fabricated details.
global_instruction: Use British (UK) English spelling, grammar and punctuation throughout. Only include information explicitly stated in the transcript. Do not infer, guess, embellish or add any details that are not directly spoken. Avoid filler content or speculative commentary.

sections.title: Executive Summary
sections.instruction: Summarise the meeting in 3â€“5 bullet points using clear British English. Include only information explicitly mentioned in the transcript. Avoid assumptions, interpretations or filler language.

sections.title: Meeting Context
sections.instruction: Provide a short paragraph in British English describing the purpose of the meeting and the attendees, but ONLY if this information is present in the transcript. Do not guess or add missing details.

sections.title: Key Takeaways
sections.instruction: List the most important points raised, using precise and concise British English. Include only facts stated in the transcript. Do not add interpretation.

sections.title: Decisions Made
sections.instruction:
Record ONLY decisions explicitly agreed during the meeting. If no decisions were confirmed, state: 'No explicit decisions were recorded during the meeting.' Use the following table format:

| Decision | Owner | Impact | Reference Transcript Segment | Timestamp |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

sections.title: Action Items
sections.instruction:
Record ONLY tasks that were clearly assigned. Do not infer ownership, deadlines, or priorities unless explicitly stated. Use British spelling for all terms. Use the following table format:

| Owner | Task | Priority (if stated) | Due Date (if stated) | Reference Transcript Segment | Timestamp |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

sections.title: Discussion Highlights
sections.instruction: Summarise each main discussion topic in natural British English. Only include points that were explicitly discussed. Avoid speculation, interpretation, or invented context.

sections.title: Risks & Concerns
sections.instruction: List any risks, issues, or concerns explicitly raised by participants. Use British spelling and avoid adding anything not directly stated.

sections.title: Opportunities & Ideas
sections.instruction: List opportunities, suggestions, or ideas mentioned during the meeting. Include only items stated specifically by participants. Avoid embellishment.

sections.title: Next Steps
sections.instruction: List follow-up actions that were mentioned explicitly. Do not add assumed next steps. If no next steps were confirmed, leave this section empty.

sections.title: Notable Quotes
sections.instruction: List short, direct quotations taken verbatim from the transcript using UK punctuation rules. Include timestamps where available. Do not paraphrase or fabricate wording.
